title: Simple Ways to Send Videos on Discord

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. You'll find this on your Start Menu or in your Applications folder. You can also visit discord.com in a web browser if you don’t have the desktop app. This process is nearly identical in the web version of Discord.

steps.title: Click the chat in which you want to share the video.
steps.content: Click the chat in which you want to share the video. This can be either a chat in a server or a private chat. To send a video in a direct message, click the blue Discord game controller icon at the top left, and then select the conversation with the person you want to message. To open a channel, click the icon for the server on which the channel resides in the left panel, and then click the channel name.

steps.title: Click the plus icon (+).
steps.content: Click the plus icon (+). It's to the left of the typing area at the bottom. [1] X Research source A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Select Upload a File.
steps.content: Select Upload a File . Your computer’s file browser will open.

steps.title: Navigate to and double-click your video.
steps.content: Navigate to and double-click your video. You can also select the video and click Open in your file browser. A thumbnail of the video will appear in the message field at the bottom of the Discord window. As long as the video is 10MB or less, you'll now have the option to type a comment and/or mark the video as a spoiler. If the video is too large to send, you'll see an error that says so. If you subscribe to Discord Nitro, you can send videos up to 500 MB. [2] X Research source If you don't want Nitro, you can upload the video somewhere else (like Dropbox) and share it as a link, or just send it through an app other than Discord.

steps.title: Add a comment (optional) and hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Add a comment (optional) and hit ↵ Enter . You can also mark the video as a spoiler if you need to by clicking the eye symbol at the top of the thumbnail. Hit Return or Enter on your keyboard to upload the file to the conversation. If you change your mind about uploading the video, click the red trash can icon at the top of the thumbnail to delete it.

steps.title: Open the Discord app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Discord app on your phone or tablet. It's the purple icon with a white game controller inside.

steps.title: Tap the chat or channel in which you want to send a video.
steps.content: Tap the chat or channel in which you want to send a video. You can upload a video to a channel or send it to someone in a direct message. To send someone a direct message, tap the icon of a speech bubble at the top left corner of the app, tap the person's name, and then tap Message . To enter a chat channel, find the server with the channel you want in the left-hand menu bar, tap the server icon, and then tap the name of the channel.

steps.title: Tap the + icon.
steps.content: Tap the + icon. It's on the left side of the typing area.

steps.title: Scroll through your gallery to find the video you want to send.
steps.content: Scroll through your gallery to find the video you want to send. By default, your phone’s photo gallery should open when you tap the + icon. Scroll through your images until you find the video you want. If it's your first time sending a photo or video, you may be asked if you want to give Discord access to your photos. You'll need to give full access if you want to send videos. Depending on your phone OS, you might also see the option to access your phone’s files instead of your photo gallery. Tap the Files icon if your video is stored in your phone’s file manager app.

steps.title: Tap the video you want to send.
steps.content: Tap the video you want to send. You can select multiple videos if you like. A checkmark will appear in the top right corner of all your selected videos and images.

steps.title: Tap the Send button.
steps.content: Tap the Send button. It's the blue oval with a white paper airplane inside. This sends the video to the selected user or channel. If the video is too large to send, you'll see an error that says so. If you subscribe to Discord Nitro, you can send videos up to 500 MB. If you don't want Nitro, you can upload the video somewhere else (like Dropbox) and share it as a link, or just send it through an app other than Discord. If you're using an Android and are unable to select a video, open your Gallery app instead, select the video, tap the Sharing icon (a sideways V with three dots), and then select Discord . At that point, you can choose a channel or DM to send the video to.

steps.title: How can I send larger videos without subscribing to Nitro?
steps.content: How can I send larger videos without subscribing to Nitro? If the video you want to share is too large for Discord, you can upload it to a site like Google Drive , Dropbox, or iCloud Drive . All of these sites allow you to share a link to the uploaded file anywhere you wish, including within a Discord channel or private message. Although you won't actually be sending the video through Discord, this can be a useful alternative. You can also upload a video to YouTube or another streaming video site and share the link in a chat or channel. YouTube allows you to share up to 15 minutes of video without being verified. To upload longer videos, you only need to verify your account . [3] X Research source Another option is to use a website like streamable.com that’s specifically for sharing videos on Discord and similar platforms.

steps.title: How can I reduce the size of my videos to upload them?
steps.content: How can I reduce the size of my videos to upload them? There are tons of apps that allow you to compress video files, which will reduce the file size but may also impact the quality of the video. Video editing software like Handbrake and QuickTime can be great for reducing the size of video files.

steps.title: Why do my videos keep uploading as file attachments?
steps.content: Why do my videos keep uploading as file attachments? If you upload a video and it appears as a downloadable file instead of an embedded video, this is probably an encoding issue. Discord's built-in player can play videos in the MP4, MOV, and WEBM formats. If the video is in a different format, the recipient may need to download it and open it in a different app.

steps.title: How do I fix videos failing to upload in the mobile app?
steps.content: How do I fix videos failing to upload in the mobile app? If you know the video is the right size and format, but it still keeps failing to upload, there may be a network issue. Try switching from cellular data to Wi-Fi or vice versa. If you’re on Wi-Fi, try switching to a different band on your router or restarting your router altogether. Some users also report that they were able to solve this problem by updating the Discord app, clearing their phone’s cache , or uninstalling and reinstalling Discord. In some cases, there may be a server issue on Discord’s end. Try waiting a few minutes to a few hours and sending the video again.

steps.title: Are there any dedicated Discord video uploaders?
steps.content: Are there any dedicated Discord video uploaders? If you’re looking for a way to automate the process of sharing videos to your Discord server, try a script like Discord Media Uploader . This script accesses a designated folder on your computer and uploads any new files to Discord whenever you enter a certain command. Check out the Readme file on the GitHub page for detailed instructions.
